entities.description: "ERASER benchmark is the primary focus of the work described, which aims to evaluate the faithfulness of models in providing rationales."
"Commonsense Explanations (CoS-E) is a dataset used to illustrate the scoring metrics comprehensiveness and sufficiency."
"Jain and Wallace are referenced for their work on importance score correlations with 'leave-one-out' scores."
"Serrano and Smith are referenced for their work on counting how many 'important' tokens need to be erased before a prediction flips."
"Samek et al. are referenced for their measurements proposed in the context of evaluating saliency maps for image classification."
"Paszke et al. are mentioned as the creators of PyTorch, which is used for the implementations in the ERASER repository."
"Comprehensiveness is a metric used to measure the influence of rationales on a model's prediction."
"Sufficiency is a metric that captures the adequacy of rationales for a model to make a prediction."
"AOPC is a metric that scores a particular token ordering under a model, based on the change in output as tokens are removed."
"$x_{i}$ represents an instance in the context of measuring comprehensiveness and sufficiency of rationales."
"$r_{i}$ represents the rationales associated with an instance $x_{i}$, used in the calculation of faithfulness scores."
"$k_{d}$ is a threshold for dataset $d$, used to convert soft scores into discrete rationales."
"$\tilde{x}_{i}$ represents the tokens comprising the provided rationale, used in the context of comprehensiveness scoring."
"$m(x_{i})_{j}$ denotes the model's prediction for instance $x_{i}$ with respect to class $j$."
"$m(x_{i}\backslash r_{i})_{j}$ denotes the model's prediction for instance $x_{i}$ without rationales, with respect to class $j$."
"$m(r_{i})_{j}$ denotes the model's prediction based solely on the rationales $r_{i}$, with respect to class $j$."
"PyTorch is the framework in which the implementations for the ERASER repository are developed."
"ERASER repository is the location where the implementations for the ERASER benchmark are made available."

relationships.description: "The ERASER benchmark uses the Commonsense Explanations (CoS-E) dataset to illustrate scoring metrics."
"ERASER benchmark's approach contrasts with the work of Jain and Wallace on importance score correlations."
"ERASER benchmark's approach contrasts with the work of Serrano and Smith on erasing 'important' tokens."
"ERASER benchmark's approach is inspired by the measurements proposed by Samek et al. for evaluating saliency maps."
"ERASER benchmark's implementations are done in PyTorch, created by Paszke et al."
"Comprehensiveness is a metric used within the ERASER benchmark to evaluate the influence of rationales."
"Sufficiency is a metric used within the ERASER benchmark to evaluate the adequacy of rationales."
"AOPC is a metric used within the ERASER benchmark to score token ordering under a model."
"$x_{i}$ is the instance for which comprehensiveness is measured when rationales are removed."
"$x_{i}$ is the instance for which sufficiency is measured using only the rationales."
"$r_{i}$ represents the rationales used to measure sufficiency, indicating the model's ability to make predictions with them."

entities.description: "Zaidan and Eisner are authors who conducted a study on movie reviews in 2008."
"Thorne et al. are authors who worked on the FEVER benchmark in 2018."
"Pearce is an author referenced for ensuring no document overlap between train, validation, and test sets in the FEVER benchmark."
"Schuster et al. are authors associated with the creation of the FEVER symmetric dataset in 2019."
"Speer is an author who contributed to cleaning up encoding errors in the dataset in 2019."
"Clark et al. are authors who worked on the BoolQ dataset in 2019."
"Camburu et al. are authors who worked on the e-SNLI dataset in 2018."
"Rajani et al. are authors who worked on the Commonsense Explanations (CoS-E) dataset in 2019."
"Talmor et al. are authors who recommended repartitioning the train and validation sets into a train, validation, and test set for their benchmark in 2019."
"Neumann et al. are authors who contributed to the SciSpacy library used for Evidence Inference in 2019."
"Wolf et al. are authors who developed bert-base-uncased used as a token embedder in 2019."
"FEVER is a benchmark event that involves processing and repartitioning of validation sets and dealing with claims and evidence."
"BoolQ is an event where a dataset required substantial processing, including identifying source paragraphs and repartitioning for testing."
"e-SNLI is an event where minimal processing was performed, involving the separation of premise and hypothesis statements."
"Commonsense Explanations (CoS-E) is an event where minimal processing was performed, primarily deletion of questions without a rationale."

ERASER is an organization responsible for tokenizing datasets using the spaCy library and releasing train/validation/test splits. It also involves tokenizing datasets into sentences, with the exception of e-SNLI and CoS-E.
Upwork is a platform used to hire annotators for the Movies and Evidence Inference datasets.
Amazon Mechanical Turk is a platform used to collect reference comprehensive rationales for the BoolQ dataset.
"Levenshtein distance ratio is a measure used to determine the similarity between two strings, with a score of at least 90 required for the BoolQ dataset."
"spaCy is a library used for tokenization of all datasets in ERASER, except for BoolQ and Evidence Inference."
"SciSpacy is a library used for tokenization in Evidence Inference, developed by Neumann et al. in 2019."
"Bidirectional LSTM is a type of neural network architecture used with a 128-dimensional hidden layer in the models by Lei et al., 2016."
"Lei et al. are authors who developed models that use a Bidirectional LSTM with a 128-dimensional hidden layer."
"bert-base-uncased is a token embedder used for all datasets except BoolQ, Evidence Inference, and FEVER, as per Wolf et al., 2019."

"Rajani et al. are researchers who fine-tuned a Transformer-based language model on free-text rationales provided by humans."
"Radford et al. are associated with the development of the Transformer-based language model that was fine-tuned by Rajani et al."
"Strout et al. are researchers who have compared rationales to human judgments in their work."
"Doshi-Velez and Kim are researchers who have elicited human evaluations of explanations."
"Ribeiro et al. are researchers involved in the evaluation of explanations."
"Lundberg and Lee are researchers who have worked on visual evaluations of saliency maps."
"Nguyen is a researcher associated with the evaluation of explanations."
"Arras et al. are researchers who have measured the impact of perturbing or erasing words or tokens identified as important on model output."
"Montavon et al. are researchers involved in automatic evaluations of faithfulness."
"Serrano and Smith are researchers who have worked on measuring the impact of perturbations on model output."
"Samek et al. are researchers who have contributed to methods measuring the impact of perturbations on model output."
"Jain and Wallace are researchers who have worked on automatic evaluations of faithfulness."
"Jacovi and Goldberg are researchers who have urged the community to evaluate faithfulness on a continuous scale of acceptability."

ERASER is an organization responsible for tokenizing datasets using the spaCy library and releasing train/validation/test splits. It also involves tokenizing datasets into sentences, with the exception of e-SNLI and CoS-E.
"Lehman et al. are researchers associated with the Evidence inference dataset, which includes full-text articles describing randomized controlled trials."
"Clark et al. are researchers who created the BoolQ corpus, consisting of passages from Wikipedia and yes/no questions generated from these passages."
"Zaidan and Eisner are researchers who included positive/negative sentiment labels on movie reviews in their dataset."
"Pang and Lee are researchers associated with the original dataset from which Zaidan and Eisner took a subset for their movie reviews dataset."
"Thorne et al. are researchers who created the FEVER dataset, which is short for Fact Extraction and VERification."
"Khashabi et al. are researchers who created the MultiRC dataset, a reading comprehension dataset composed of questions with multiple correct answers."
"Talmor et al. are researchers who created the CoS-E corpus, which comprises multiple-choice questions("entity"
"Movie Reviews is a dataset that includes positive/negative sentiment labels on movie reviews."
"FEVER, short for Fact Extraction and VERification, is a dataset for verifying claims from textual sources."
"MultiRC is a reading comprehension dataset composed of questions with multiple correct answers that depend on information from multiple sentences."
"Commonsense Explanations (CoS-E) is a corpus comprising multiple-choice questions and answers with supporting rationales."
"e-SNLI is a dataset that augments the SNLI corpus with rationales marked in the premise and/or hypothesis."
"Appendix A is a section of the text that contains additional information and processing details for the datasets in ERASER."
"An image file mentioned in the text, potentially related to the datasets or rationales discussed."
"A language model fine-tuned by Rajani et al. on free-text rationales provided by humans, aimed at improving performance on downstream tasks."
"Human rationales are explanations provided by humans that are used to fine-tune the Transformer-based language model."
"Rationalities refer to the explanations or reasons that support a particular decision or action, often evaluated against human judgments."
"Faithful rationales are those that correspond to the inputs most relied upon by a model to make a prediction."
"Perturbation refers to the process of altering or erasing words or tokens identified as important to measure the impact on model output."
"Randomized controlled trials are a type of scientific experiment used to infer the effect of an intervention on a specified outcome."
"Evidence inference is the task of determining whether a given intervention significantly affects a specified outcome based on full-text articles describing randomized controlled trials."
"Comprehensive rationale annotations are detailed markings of rationales supporting specific inferences, collected on a subset of the validation and test data."
"Public release refers to the act of making the test sets of the datasets publicly available."
"Hidden test set evaluation is a future plan to offer additional human annotations on held-out portions of some corpora for evaluation purposes."
"Repartition refers to the process of reorganizing the training and validation sets to provide a canonical test split, as done in the Commonsense Explanations dataset."
"Highlighted supporting snippets are parts of text extracted to support rationales, used in the Commonsense Explanations dataset."
"e-SNLI is an event or dataset augmentation of the SNLI corpus with rationales marked in the premise and/or hypothesis."
"The SNLI corpus is the original dataset that e-SNLI augments, focusing on natural language inference tasks."

ERASER is an organization responsible for tokenizing datasets using the spaCy library and releasing train/validation/test splits. It also involves tokenizing datasets into sentences, with the exception of e-SNLI and CoS-E.
Upwork is a platform used to hire annotators for the Movies and Evidence Inference datasets.
"Amazon Turk is another platform used to hire annotators for the task of extracting rationales."
"Cohen is the author referenced in relation to the Cohen's kappa statistic, which measures human agreement over extracted rationales."
"Movie Reviews is a dataset used to calculate mean agreement of individual annotators with the majority vote per token."
"BoolQ is another dataset used for calculating mean agreement of annotators with the majority vote per token."
"CoS-E is a dataset mentioned in the context of annotating a subset for comparison to existing rationales."
"MultiRC is a dataset mentioned in the context of annotating a subset for comparison to existing rationales."
"FEVER is a dataset mentioned in the context of annotating a subset for comparison to existing rationales."
"Evidence Inference from Medical Doctors refers to a dataset where comprehensive rationales were collected due to the high expertise of the annotators."
"Camburu et al. are the authors responsible for the e-SNLI dataset, augmenting the SNLI corpus with rationales."
"ERASER models refer to the models evaluated by the ERASER project for both predictive performance and rationale extraction quality."
"Cohen $\kappa$ is a statistical measure of inter-annotator agreement, mentioned in the context of human agreement over extracted rationales."
"IOU stands for Intersection-Over-Union, a metric borrowed from computer vision used to measure partial matches between predicted and reference rationales."
"F1 score is a measure of a test's accuracy, used here to calculate an F1 score based on partial matches for rationale extraction."
"AUPRC stands for Area Under the Precision-Recall curve, a metric used to evaluate continuous or soft token scoring models."
"Zaidan et al. are referenced in the context of measuring rationale faithfulness, with prior work motivating some of the metrics proposed."
"Yu et al. are referenced in the context of defining metrics to measure the comprehensiveness and sufficiency of rationales."
"Table 2 is mentioned as a reference for human agreement with respect to rationales across various datasets."
"Table 3 is highlighted to contain information about which corpora have comprehensive rationales in the test set."
"Contrast examples are used to calculate rationale comprehensiveness by comparing model predictions with and without rationales."

relationships.description: "e-SNLI augments the SNLI corpus with rationales, making it a direct extension of the original dataset."
"ERASER evaluates models and their rationales extracted from the e-SNLI dataset."
"ERASER uses Upwork to hire annotators for extracting rationales, indicating a contractual relationship."
"ERASER uses Amazon Turk to hire annotators for extracting rationales, indicating a contractual relationship."
"ERASER calculates mean agreement of annotators with the majority vote per token for the Movie Reviews dataset."
"ERASER calculates mean agreement of annotators with the majority vote per token for the BoolQ dataset."

"Camburu et al. are the creators of the e-SNLI dataset."
"ERASER models are evaluated by the ERASER project."
"IOU is used to calculate an F1 score for partial matches between predicted and reference rationales."
"AUPRC is a metric used to evaluate the ERASER models for continuous or soft token scoring."
"ERASER's metrics for measuring rationale faithfulness are motivated by the work of Zaidan et al."
"ERASER defines metrics for comprehensiveness and sufficiency of rationales following the work of Yu et al."

entities.description: "Lei et al. (2016) refers to a group of researchers who developed a model for hard selection in dataset analysis."
"REINFORCE is an estimation style used for training the modules in the model proposed by Lei et al. (2016), aiming to minimize loss over expected binary vectors."
"BERT is a base module used in the implementation of Lei et al. (2016)'s model, known for inducing contextualized representations of tokens."
"GloVe is another base module used in the model, alongside BERT, for inducing contextualized representations of tokens."
"Hochreiter and Schmidhuber (1997) are associated with the development of bidirectional LSTMs used in the model for both encoder and decoder."
"Bahdanau et al. (2015) are known for the attentive decoding layer used in the pipeline models for composing hidden representations."
"Cho et al. (2014) are associated with the development of the Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) used in the pipeline models for sentence segmentation."
"Lehman et al. (2019) described a simple pipeline model in prior work, which is referenced in the text."
"Devlin et al. (2019) are associated with the development of the BERT module used in various stages of the models discussed in the text."
"Williams and Zipser (1989) are related to the concept of teacher forcing used in the classification stage of the pipeline models."
"Ribeiro et al. (2016) are associated with the LIME method considered for soft scoring features in the models."
"Pennington et al., 2014 are associated with the development of GloVe embeddings used in the model for token representation."
"CoS-E is an event or dataset used for evaluating the performance of models, mentioned in the context of accuracy metrics."
"e-SNLI is an event or dataset used for evaluating the performance of models, particularly BertTo-Bert for CoS-E."
"BoolQ is an event or dataset that comprises very long inputs, exceeding the token limit for BERT models."
"Evidence Inference is an event or dataset that also comprises very long inputs, exceeding the token limit for BERT models."
"AOPC refers to a metric used for evaluating the comprehensiveness and sufficiency of models, as mentioned in the context of soft scoring models."
"LIME is a method used for soft scoring features, mentioned as an approach considered in the models."
"Simple gradients is a concept used for soft scoring features, mentioned as an approach considered in the models."
"Attention is a concept used for inducing over contextualized representations for soft scoring features."

relationships.description: "Lei et al. (2016)'s model uses the REINFORCE style for training the modules, indicating a direct relationship."
"The model by Lei et al. (2016) incorporates BERT as a base module for inducing contextualized representations."
"The model by Lei et al. (2016) also uses GloVe as a base module, similar to BERT, for inducing contextualized representations."
"Lei et al. (2016)'s model uses bidirectional LSTMs developed by Hochreiter and Schmidhuber (1997) for the encoder and decoder."
"Lei et al. (2016)'s model uses GloVe embeddings developed by Pennington et al., 2014."
"BERT is used for evaluating performance on the CoS-E event or dataset."
"BERT is used for evaluating performance on the e-SNLI event or dataset."
"BERT could not be used for BoolQ due to the length of inputs, requiring an alternative approach with GloVe."
"BERT could not be used for Evidence Inference due to the length of inputs, requiring an alternative approach with GloVe."

entities.description: "Lei et al., 2016 refers to a group of researchers who published a paper on models, setting sparsity rate and contiguity loss weight."
"bert-base-uncased is a token embedder used in models, developed by Wolf et al., 2019."
"Bidirectional LSTM refers to a type of neural network architecture used in the models."
"Srivastava et al., 2014 refers to the authors who introduced the concept of dropout in neural networks."
"MLP stands for Multi-Layer Perceptron, a type of neural network used in the models."
"GloVe embeddings are a type of pre-trained word vectors used in some models, developed by Pennington et al., 2014."
"Adam is an optimization algorithm used in training models, developed by Kingma and Ba, 2014."
"AllenNLP library is a machine learning library used to implement models, developed by Gardner et al., 2018."
"BERT-LSTM/GloVe-LSTM refers to a type of model that combines BERT and LSTM architectures."
"Lehman et al., 2019 refers to a group of researchers who published a paper on models using GLoVe word vectors."
"Pyysalo et al., 2013 refers to the authors who developed PubMed word vectors used in the Evidence Inference dataset."
"BERT-to-BERT model refers to a model that uses BERT for both identification and classification pipeline components."
"Beltagy et al., 2019 refers to the authors who developed SciBERT, used in the Evidence Inference dataset."
"Evidence Inference is a dataset that uses a different embedding method and is mentioned in the context of model training."
"FEVER is a dataset that is mentioned as an exception for the use of bert-base-uncased as a token embedder."

"Kingma and Ba, 2014 are the authors who introduced the Adam optimization algorithm used in model training."
"Pennington et al., 2014 are the authors who developed the GLoVe word vectors used in some models."
"Wolf et al., 2019 are the authors who developed bert-base-uncased used as a token embedder in the models."
"BERT encoder is the part of the BERT model that is fine-tuned in the models mentioned, with the top two layers being adjusted."
"ReLU activation is used in the one layer MLP with 128 dimensional hidden state to compute the decoder output distribution."
"Early stopping is a technique used in model training to prevent overfitting, with a patience of 5 epochs for most models."
"Validation set is used for model selection, monitoring the final task performance metric and validation loss."
"Attention layer is part of the model where dropout is applied before feeding the hidden representations."
"Linear layer is part of the encoder where dropout is applied before feeding the hidden representations."
"Encoder is a component of the model where linear layer and dropout are applied before feeding the hidden representations."
"Decoder is a component of the model where attention layer and dropout are applied before feeding the hidden representations."

entities.entity_name: "KHOURY COLLEGE OF COMPUTER SCIENCES, NORTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY"
entities.description: "Khoury College of Computer Sciences, Northeastern University is one of the institutions where some of the contributors to the ERASER benchmark are affiliated."
"Salesforce Research, Palo Alto, CA, 94301 is one of the institutions where some of the contributors to the ERASER benchmark are affiliated."
"ERASER Benchmark is a proposed benchmark to advance research on interpretable models in NLP, comprising multiple datasets and tasks with human annotations of 'rationales'."
"GLUE Benchmark is a reference to a previous benchmark for evaluating progress in natural language understanding tasks."
"SuperGLUE Benchmark is a reference to a previous benchmark for evaluating progress in natural language understanding tasks."
"Palo Alto is a geographical location, home to Salesforce Research, one of the affiliations of ERASER contributors."
"CA refers to California, the state where Palo Alto is located and where Salesforce Research is based."
"94301 is the zip code for Palo Alto, indicating the specific location of Salesforce Research."
"NLP stands for Natural Language Processing, the field in which the ERASER benchmark is designed to advance research on interpretable models."
"Interpretability refers to the ability of a model to explain its predictions, a key focus in the ERASER benchmark."
"Rationales are the supporting evidence or explanations provided by models, which are a central aspect of the ERASER benchmark."
"Human annotations refer to the process of marking rationales by humans, which are collected in the ERASER datasets."
"Faithfulness is a measure of the degree to which provided rationales influenced the corresponding predictions, one of the metrics proposed in ERASER."

entities.description: ERASER is an organization responsible for tokenizing datasets using the spaCy library and releasing train/validation/test splits. It also involves tokenizing datasets into sentences, with the exception of e-SNLI and CoS-E.
"Lei et al. (2016) is referenced for their 'rationalizing' model which outperforms other models when using a BERT encoder."
"Lehman et al. (2019) is mentioned for their simple pipeline model which is not appropriate for datasets with very short rationales."
"Zhang et al. (2016) is referenced in the context of prior work where exploiting rationale-level supervision improves agreement with human-provided rationales."
"Strout et al. (2019) is mentioned in relation to prior work where exploiting rationale-level supervision improves agreement with human-provided rationales."
"Jain and Wallace (2019) is referenced for their work which is consistent with the finding that simple gradient and LIME-based scoring yield more comprehensive rationales than attention weights."
"Serrano and Smith (2019) is referenced for their work which supports the finding that simple gradient and LIME-based scoring yield more comprehensive rationales than attention weights."
"Zhong et al. (2019) is mentioned in the context of prior findings that attention may provide plausible, but not faithful, explanations."
"NSF (CAREER award 1750978) is an organization that provided support for the work discussed in the text."
"Army Research Office (W911NF1810328) is an organization that provided support for the work discussed in the text."
"David Alvarez-Melis and Tommi Jaakkola are authors of a paper referenced in the text, presenting a causal framework for explaining the predictions of black-box sequence-to-sequence models."
"Movies is one of the datasets mentioned where random removal of rationales is particularly damaging to performance, indicating poor absolute ranking."
"FEVER is one of the datasets mentioned where random removal of rationales is particularly damaging to performance, indicating poor absolute ranking."
"CoS-E is one of the datasets mentioned where random removal of rationales is particularly damaging to performance, indicating poor absolute ranking."
"eSNLI is one of the datasets mentioned where random removal of rationales is particularly damaging to performance, indicating poor absolute ranking."
"AUPRC stands for Area Under the Precision Recall Curve, a metric used to assess the quality of token scores with respect to human annotations."
"LIME is referenced for its method of scoring which yields more comprehensive rationales than attention weights, according to the text."
"Random refers to the process of assigning random scores to tokens to induce orderings, used as a point of reference for the metrics of comprehensiveness and sufficiency."
"BERT is a technology used in the BERT-based implementation of Lei et al. (2016), which is discussed in the context of model performance."
"ERASER benchmark is an event or process where different models are evaluated and compared based on their performance and rationale extraction capabilities."

ERASER is an organization responsible for tokenizing datasets using the spaCy library and releasing train/validation/test splits. It also involves tokenizing datasets into sentences, with the exception of e-SNLI and CoS-E.
"Bahdanau et al., 2015 are researchers who contributed to the field of attention mechanisms in neural models for text classification."
"Jain and Wallace, 2019 are researchers who have studied the limitations of attention weights in providing faithful explanations for predictions."
"Serrano and Smith, 2019 are researchers who have contributed to the understanding of attention mechanisms and their limitations."
"Wiegreffe and Pinter, 2019 are researchers who have studied the interpretation of attention weights in neural models."

"Lei et al., 2016 are researchers who proposed a two-model approach for extracting rationales and making predictions."
"Jain et al., 2020 proposed a variant of the two-model setup for extracting rationales using heuristic feature scores."
"Chang et al., 2019 introduced the concept of classwise rationales to explain support for different output classes using a game theoretic framework."
"Bastings et al., 2019 proposed using a differentiable binary mask over inputs as a means of providing explanations."

"Smilkov et al., 2017 are researchers who have studied gradient-based explanations in model predictions."
"Feng et al., 2018 are researchers who have studied the counterintuitive behaviors of gradient-based explanations."

"Zaidan and Eisner, 2008 are researchers who have studied the efficiency of collecting rationales from annotators in terms of model performance."
"McDonnell et al., 2017 are researchers who observed that providing rationales does not impose much additional effort on annotators."
"Settles, 2012 is a researcher who has explored the combination of rationale annotation with active learning."
"Wallace et al., 2010 are researchers who have contributed to the field of active learning in the context of rationale annotation."
"Sharma et al., 2015 are researchers who have studied the combination of rationale annotation with active learning."
"Zaidan et al., 2007 are researchers who proposed extending standard discriminative models with regularization terms to incorporate rationales."
"Small et al., 2011 are researchers who have contributed to the field of learning from rationales marked by annotators for text classification."
"Zhang et al., 2016 proposed a rationale-augmented Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for text classification."
"Strout et al., 2019 showed that providing a rationale-augmented CNN with rationales during training yields predicted rationales preferred by humans."
"Lehman et al., 2019 are researchers who have proposed ‘pipeline’ approaches for rationale extraction and classification."
"Chen et al., 2019 are researchers who have proposed ‘pipeline’ approaches for rationale extraction and classification."
"Williams, 1992 is a researcher who proposed the REINFORCE style optimization used in training models for rationale extraction."
"NLP stands for Natural Language Processing, the field in which ERASER and related work are focused."
"Attention mechanisms are a technique used in neural models to assign weights to token representations for extracting rationales."
"Hard attention mechanisms discretely extract snippets from the input to provide faithful explanations in neural models."
"Token-level supervision refers to the use of instance-level supervision for training models to explain or rationalize predictions."
"Rationales are explanations provided for model predictions, often marked by humans during training."
"Text classification is a task where models categorize text into different classes, often using rationales to improve performance."
